name: G. Yet Another DAG Problem
statement:
You are given a directed acyclic graph (a directed graph that does not
contain cycles) of n vertices and m arcs. The i-th arc leads from the
vertex x_i to the vertex y_i and has the weight w_i.Your task is to
select an integer a_v for each vertex v, and then write a number b_i on
each arcs i such that b_i = a_{x_i} - a_{y_i}. You must select the
numbers so that: all b_i are positive; the value of the expression
sum
limits_{i = 1}^{m} w_i b_i is the lowest possible. It can be shown that
for any directed acyclic graph with non-negative w_i, such a way to
choose numbers exists.
